medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's pain started 5 days ago. He was admitted for 2 days during which a CT scan did not identify a cause. After discharge, he experienced fevers up to 101.5Â°F along with anorexia, nausea, and vomiting. He reports vague abdomen pain that radiates to the mid-epigastrium and is accompanied by nausea. He has been taking excessive NSAIDs prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gastritis, NSAID overuse, history of multiple orthopedic surgeries (left and right ACL reconstructions, left Achilles tendon repair, right shoulder SLAP repair and biceps debridement, surgery on right wrist).
